member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ArgumentType
member.summary: Used to control parsing of command line arguments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ArgumentType.Required
member.summary: Indicates that this field is required. An error will be displayed if it is not present when parsing arguments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ArgumentType.Unique
member.summary: Only valid in conjunction with Multiple. Duplicate values will result in an error.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ArgumentType.Multiple
member.summary: Indicates that the argument may be specified more than once. Only valid if the argument is a collection

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ArgumentType.AtMostOnce
member.summary: The default type for non-collection arguments. The argument is not required, but an error will be reported if it is specified more than once.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ArgumentType.LastOccurenceWins
member.summary: For non-collection arguments, when the argument is specified more than once no error is reported and the value of the argument is the last value which occurs in the argument list.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ArgumentType.MultipleUnique
member.summary: The default type for collection arguments. The argument is permitted to occur multiple times, but duplicate values will cause an error to be reported.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ArgumentAttribute

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ArgumentAttribute.ShortName
member.summary: The short name of the argument. Set to null means use the default short name if it does not conflict with any other parameter name. Set to String.Empty for no short name. This property should not be set for DefaultArgumentAttributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ArgumentAttribute.DefaultLongName
member.summary: Returns true if the argument did not have an explicit long name specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ArgumentAttribute.LongName
member.summary: The long name of the argument. Set to null means use the default long name. The long name for every argument must be unique. It is an error to specify a long name of String.Empty.

member.summary: The default value of the argument.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.DefaultArgumentAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that this argument is the default argument. '/' or '-' prefix only the argument value is specified. The ShortName property should not be set for DefaultArgumentAttribute instances. The LongName property is used for usage text only and does not affect the usage of the argument.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.DefaultArgumentAttribute.#ctor(Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ArgumentType)

member.param: Specifies the error checking to be done on the argument.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ErrorReporter
member.summary: A delegate used in error reporting.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.Parser
member.summary:
Parser for command line arguments.
The parser specification is inferred from the instance fields of the object specified as the destination of the parse. Valid argument types are: int, uint, string, bool, enums Also argument types of Array of the above types are also valid.
Error checking options can be controlled by adding a ArgumentAttribute to the instance fields of the destination object.
At most one field may be marked with the DefaultArgumentAttribute indicating that arguments without a '-' or '/' prefix will be parsed as that argument.
If not specified then the parser will infer default options for parsing each instance field. The default long name of the argument is the field name. The default short name is the first character of the long name. Long names and explicitly specified short names must be unique. Default short names will be used provided that the default short name does not conflict with a long name or an explicitly specified short name.
Arguments which are array types are collection arguments. Collection arguments can be specified multiple times.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.Parser.#ctor
member.summary: Don't ever call this.
Parses Command Line Arguments. Use ArgumentAttributes to control parsing behavior.
member.param: Parser used to parse the arguments
member.returns: true if no errors were detected

member.summary: Checks if a set of arguments asks for help.
member.returns: Returns true if args contains /? or /help

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.Parser.ParseVersion(System.String[])
member.summary: Checks if a set of arguments asks for the version.

member.param: The type of the arguments to display usage for
member.returns: Printable string containing a user friendly description of command line arguments

For the Publish and Script actions, SourceFile may be a .dacpac file or a schema compare .scmp file. If this parameter is used, no other source parameter is valid..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.DacServiceResources.TargetTimeout
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Specifies the timeout for establishing a connection to the target database in seconds. For Azure AD, it is recommended that this value be greater than or equal to 30 seconds..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.DacServiceResources.TargetTrustServerCertificate
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Specifies whether to use TLS to encrypt the target database connection and bypass walking the certificate chain to validate trust..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.DacServiceResources.TargetUser
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to For SQL Server Auth scenarios, defines the SQL Server user to use to access the target database..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.DacServiceResources.TenantId
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Represents the Azure AD tenant ID or domain name. This option is required to support guest or imported Azure AD users as well as Microsoft accounts such as outlook.com, hotmail.com, or live.com. If this parameter is omitted, the default tenant ID for Azure AD will be used, assuming that the authenticated user is a native user for this AD. However, in this case any guest or imported users and/or Microsoft accounts hosted in this Azure AD are not supported and the operation will fail..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.DacServiceResources.TenantId_onlineAddendum
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to
For more information about Active Directory Universal Authentication, see [Universal Authentication with SQL Database and Azure Synapse Analytics (SSMS support for MFA)](/azure/sql-database/sql-database-ssms-mfa-authentication)..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.DacServiceResources.ThreadMaxStackSize
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Specifies the maximum size in megabytes for the thread running the SqlPackage.exe action. This option should only be used when encountering stack overflow exceptions that occur when parsing very large TSQL statements..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.DacServiceResources.UniversalAuthentication
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Specifies if Universal Authentication should be used. When set to True, the interactive authentication protocol is activated supporting MFA. This option can also be used for Azure AD authentication without MFA, using an interactive protocol requiring the user to enter their username and password or integrated authentication (Windows credentials). When /UniversalAuthentication is set to True, no Azure AD authentication can be specified in SourceConnectionString (/scs). When /UniversalAuthentication is set to [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.SqlPackageBigDataStateProvider
member.summary: Sqlpackage implementation for the BigDataStateProvider. TODO: Add resumability. Currently, state is stored in a ConcurrentDictionary(like the TestBigDataStateProvider), but the state needs to be stored in local storage (or ideally in Azure) to be able to resume an extract or deploy operation.

member.returns: DataOperationStepState NotFound if a record was not found for the table step. Otherwise the state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ValidationUtil.ParseNameValues(System.String[],System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}}@,System.Action{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Parses list of strings into name value pairs on the basis of Separating Character.
member.param: optional delegate which reports all the name value pairs one by one.
member.returns: Returns true if all strings are parsed in name value pairs successfully.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ValidationUtil.ReportDuplicateProperties(Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.CommandLineArguments,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.String})
member.summary: Reports duplicate properties with corresponding values. This is used only for duplicate properties corresponding to extract and deploy options. Other properties and arguments are being taken care by the argument parser.
Parses properties specified in the commandline arguments.
member.param: returns list of properties which are not defined as arguments or properties in the parser.
returns list of properties which are specified more than once.
member.returns: Returns true if property parsing completes without any error.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.ValidationUtil.ValidateEnumProperties(Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.CommandLineTool.CommandLineProperty)
member.summary: Validates the parsed properties contain only valid Enum values.

Validates if parser's IgnoredArguments belong to the validProperties or not and adds the ones which doesn't belong to the validProperties to invalidProperties. While going over all the invalid arguments, it also keeps track of duplication.
member.param: IgnoredArguments which doesn't belong to validProperties.
IgnoredArgumetns which have occured more than once.
member.returns: Returns true if validation is completed successfully.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.Compatibility.Contracts.PackageServiceMessageType
member.summary: Enum defining message types sendable to the package service. This API must not be changed once it has been shipped as both sides must bind to this service.
